subject: Re: [junit] garbage-collection of tests
msgSnippet: Don t all runners use the static suite method if it exists? - Neil ... From: Timothy Wall  To:  Sent: Wednesday,
messageBody:
Don't all runners use the static suite method if it exists?

- Neil

----- Original Message -----
From: "Timothy Wall" <twall@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, September 08, 2004 9:19 PM
Subject: Re: [junit] garbage-collection of tests


> My two main methods of running tests are
> 1) the full suite via ant/junitreport, which scans for java file
> patterns to collect the tests
> 2) one-off or single TestCase suite invocations from a shell, using a
> main method for the TestCase class
>
> I use a helper class in almost all the main methods, so using a
> decorator could work for #2, but it doesn't help #1 without modifying
> the ant target underlying code or finding a new one.
>
>
> On Sep 8, 2004, at 1:02 PM, Neil Swingler wrote:
>
>>
>>
>> You could introduce a decorator for the TestCase which could null it's
>> reference to the real TestCase as soon as it has finished executing.
>>
>> See my example (name.swingler.neil.classreloader.zip) in the files
>> section which uses this technique to introduce a new classloader for
>> each TestCase instance:
>>
>> - Neil
>>
